This paper, the first major piece of his philosophy of religion, was presented at a conference I organized in Highlands, North Carolina, in June, 1995. The paper was published in this journal the following year and has been reprinted in several other places. Space does not permit me to consider the additional material that comprises Rorty's philosophy of religion or to elaborate on what I am calling his "aestheticized spirituality," but I hope to do so in another context.
